newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: SEU sees yr profit of at least NZ$4.5 mln.
newsitem.headline: SEU sees yr profit of at least NZ$4.5 mln.

text.p: South Eastern Utilities on Tuesday said its year profit will be no less than NZ$4.5 million.
SEU said its wholly owned subsidiary, Wairarapa Electricity Limited, had completed contractual negotiations with Trans Power New Zealand.
After allowing for transmission charges now being levied by the generators, and factoring in other efficiency gains, the tax paid profitability would improve by $1.5 million per annum.
Only part of this is reflected in South Eastern's current year's tax paid operating profit which is still forecast to be no less than $4.5 million.
A full year of such cost savings would result in enhanced ongoing tax paid operating profit of $5.7 million for South Eastern.
Wairarapa Electricity's new ODV at 30 June 1996 is $62 million.
This will result in South Eastern's shareholders' funds being enhanced by $9.5 million.
